title: Inktrapping
content:
In [my previous thread **(Beginning with/Besides the "g")**](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417121801/http:/typophile.com/node/54942) I obtained an unsuspected result in shaping an individual character, that obvioulsy influenced the rest of the typeface:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417121801im_/http:/typophile.com/files/g-force_6019.png)
  
Being the basic structure is almost done, now it's time to make some subtle adjustments.  
This is the current uppercase alphabet: 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417121801im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture1_5992.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417121801im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture2_6068.png)
  
And these are some samples of what I'm starting to do about trap (BTW, thanks to [Hrant Papazian's technique guidance](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417121801/http:/themicrofoundry.com/ss_trapping1.html)): 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417121801im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture3_5975.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417121801im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture4_5616.png)
  
[I'll post a PDF for best viewing, beyond the lack of hinting]  
I'd like to hear some critique, the harder, the better.  
Thank you.
author: Marcelo Soler

comments.content: Nice, I think they look rather polished. Hrant's trapping technique looks interesting. What kind of diameter circles are those? I'll wait for the PDF to look at it more closely.

Thanks, Jelmar.  
_What kind of diameter circles are those?_  
I'll post an explanatory PDF on this, ASAP.

**MarS**

I think the traps look promising, but to be honest, for me at least it's pretty futile to try and judge inktraps (of all things!) by staring at huge glyphs on a monitor. Hell, I can't even tell if you need traps. So, yup, looking forward to the PDF. :-)

Also, I'd second Jelmar, I'd love some explanation on how exactly you applied Hrant's method!

_"...to be honest, for me at least it’s pretty futile to try and judge inktraps (of all things!) by staring at huge glyphs on a monitor."_  
LOL! It's somehow a "voyeuristical" task, ain't it? Even in hard copies, I tend to think of ink traps more as a shape-for-the-shape-itself (BTW, not necessarily arbitrary) than as a functional unavoidable requirement.

**MarS**

I agree that it is rather futile to judge inktraps on screen, to judge if you even need them at all. Although I think it's safe to say that you always need some form of optical correction (in the form of inktraps or in other ways). And yes, I think aesthetics also plays a role (shape-for-the-shape-itself).

Looking forward to the PDF about the trapping technique (it's Hrant's technique, so he must be okay with it).
Hey, any update on this? Long time no see.
